page.title: 07FARMING _ CHIGNALS
page.content: Wheat and oil-seed rape are the mainrops grown, others being barley, peas, sugar beet, potatoes, and maize. Animals are limited to pigs, chickens, pheasants, geese and ducks. The fields are large in size allowing for the easy use of machinery which comprises mainly combine harvesters, tractors, fork lifts, diggers and trucks.The fields tend to be irregular in shape. Labour is low due to the use of machinery. The main form of irrigation is from the many small reservoirs found in the area. The people in the area are concerned with the rooting up of hedgerows by farmers in order to make larger fields.
